enb_long_title: Tenth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
sentences: AUSTRALIA and JAPAN stressed the importance of fostering multilateral cooperation on mitigation initiatives.
CANADA expressed optimism at the varied mitigation efforts ongoing globally.
The US highlighted the importance of partnerships and proposed that SBSTA address policy tools for clean coal production and energy efficiency.
The INTERNATIONAL ENERGY AGENCY (IEA) said effective mitigation requires a portfolio of technologies and effective policy frameworks.
He noted that the IEA is hosting more than 40 implementing agreements on technology development.
The EU, with the COOK ISLANDS, said barriers to the uptake of small-scale renewable energy need to be addressed further.
